module.p: -(e)achd is a suffix used to create feminine derived common nouns from adjectives or from other common nouns.

For example –
ain-diadhaidh godless, irreligious ⇒ ain-diadhachd godlessness, impiety
(aindeòin reluctance ⇒ ) aindeònach reluctant, unwilling ⇒ aindeònachd unwillingness, reluctance
geur bitter, sharp ⇒ geurachd asperity
manach
monk, friar ⇒ manachail
monastic, monkish ⇒ manachalachd
monasticism
mì-chneasta cruel, merciless ⇒ mì-chneastachd cruelty, mercilessness
mì-chuanta untidy ⇒ mì-chuantachd untidiness
mì-dhìleas faithless ⇒ mì-dhìlseachd faithlessness
mì-dhaonna inhuman ⇒ mì-dhaonnachd inhumanity
mì-fhreagarrach incongruence ⇒ mì-fhreagarrachd incongruity
mì-laghail unlawful ⇒ mì-laghalachd illegality
mì-mhodhail rude ⇒ mì-mhodhalachd incivility
mì-riaghailteach disorderly ⇒ mì-riaghailteachd eccentricity
(mì-stuaim immodesty ⇒ ) mì-stuama immodest, profligate ⇒ mì-stuamachd profligacy
(mì-thaing ingratitude ⇒ ) mì-thaingeil ungrateful ⇒ mì-thaingealachd ingratitude
naomh holy ⇒ naomhachd holiness
sleamhainn slippery ⇒ sleamhnachd slipperiness

For example –
bàrr
top ⇒ barrachd fem. larger quantity, more
croit fem. croft ⇒ croitear
crofter ⇒ croitearachd fem. crofting, croftership
easbaig
bishop ⇒ easbaigeachd
episcopacy
gobha metalsmith (genitive gobhainn) ⇒ goibhneachd fem. metalsmithing
mùtaire, cùl-mhùtaire smuggler ⇒ mùtaireachd, cùl-mhùtaireachd smuggling
mì-dhealbh deformity ⇒ mì-dhealbhachd deformity
sagart
priest ⇒ sagartachd
priesthood
sgìre fem. district ⇒ sgìreachd fem. district
